**The Precious Repentance for Great Life of the Eastern Peak**

**Title:** *The Precious Repentance for Great Life of the Eastern Peak* (*Dongyue Dasheng Bao Chan*). One fascicle. Source text: *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, *Dongxuan* Section, *Weiyi* Category.

**Purification of Heaven and Earth Spell**  
**Purification of the Altar**

We reverently declare:
Fragrant incense ascends in solemn mist, suffusing the Great Void;
With sincere devotion, we dare not falter, though the distance be but a foot.
We humbly burn precious incense, offering it in worship to:
The Azure Emperor of Broad Life of Mount Tai, the Eastern Peak;
The Heavenly Equal Great Life Benevolent and Holy Emperor of the Eastern Peak;
The True Lord of the Nine Heavens, Minister of Destiny;
The Most Sacred and Majestic Illustrious Benevolent King of the Upper Hall;
The Virtuous and Radiant Empress of the Eastern Peak;
The Great King of National Protection of the Western Qi;
The Immortal Officials of the Grotto-Heavens of Pengxuan and Kongdong;
The Deputy Immortal Officials of Changbai Mountain;
The Deputy Immortal Officials of Liangfu Mountain;
The Sacred Heirs, the Protective and Benevolent Lords, the Serene and Discerning Masters, the Proclaiming Spirits;
The Four Peaks and Four Heavenly Sacred Emperors;
The Two Great Saints, Left and Right Prime Ministers Zhang and Kang;
The Manifestly Responsive Thousand Saints, the Lesser Kings, and Lord Cui of the Earthly Prison;
The Elder of Haoli, the Minister of Increasing Fortune;
The Illustrious and Benevolent Manifest King;
The King of National Protection and Manifest Response;
The True Lord of Pure Source and Wondrous Dao;
The Loyal, Brave, and Martial King of Pacification, the True Lord of Exalted Peace;
The Duke of National Protection and Auspicious Response, the River Spirit Marquis;
The Six Ministries, the Ministry of Goodness, the Ministry of Evil;
The Six Bureaus, the Chamberlains, the Two Generals of the Hall;
The Left and Right Generals of the Gold Bird Guard;
The Three Yuan Lords, the Three Marquis of Wuke;
The Two Kings of the Left and Right Gates, the White Mule Great King;
The Marshal Wen, Commander of the Earthly Spirits;
The Nine Great Marshals of the Earthly Court;
The Marshal Zhu, Pursuer of Souls;
The Marshal Liu, Assistant to the True Lords;
The Seventy-Five Judges, the Twenty-Four Case Officers;
The Immortal Officials of the Thirty-Six Grotto-Heavens, the Seventy-Two Blessed Lands, and the Governors of the Jinglu Blessed Lands;
The Sacred Assembly of the Eastern Peak;
The Spirit of the Current Year’s Grand Marshal, the Protective Marquis Gao;
The Lord of the Great City God of All Under Heaven;
The Earth Spirits of the Nine Provinces;
The Deities of the Year, Month, Day, and Hour;
The Merit Officers of the Four Directions;
The Deities of the Temples and Shrines of the Prefectures, Subprefectures, and Counties.

All rely upon the true incense, universally offered in worship.

This incense—purple and void, richly fragrant—gathers the numinous winds and dense clouds, ascending directly to the Grotto-Heavens.
May the Incense Officials convey our petition, reporting it before the Emperor.
May all we declare be granted as spoken, our sincerest sentiments fully revealed.

We humbly hope:
Banners and standards, borne by clouds, descend past the Tiger Pass;
The wind clears the way, the phoenix carriage’s bells harmonize.
A hundred lords attend in solemn ranks, a thousand officials escort in formation.
All descend to this humble altar, gazing upon our pure devotion.

Now, with orchid altars purified and precious incense thickly perfuming,
we face the sacred and true, proclaiming the repentance ritual.
We bow our heads in reverence, taking refuge in the Boundless Dao.

**The Three Refuges**
With devoted hearts, we take refuge in the Dao-Treasures of the Ten Directions.
May all beings turn their minds toward faith and reverence.

With devoted hearts, we take refuge in the Scripture-Treasures of the Ten Directions.
May all beings awaken to understanding, receive, uphold, and recite them.

With devoted hearts, we take refuge in the Master-Treasures of the Ten Directions.
May all beings ascend the Dharma-Bridge without hindrance.

**Declaration**
We have heard:
Before the primordial chaos divided, a single *qi* stretched boundlessly;
Once high and low were arrayed, the Three Powers took form.
The earth was divided into the Five Peaks, yet none held greater authority than Mount Tai.
It stands as the pillar of Qi and Lu, the guardian of the Horn and Neck constellations.
In the Yu dynasty, the royal hunt was marked by the solemnity of burnt offerings;
In the Zhou era, seasonal tours were honored with ritual gifts.
It has been revered beyond compare.

We humbly consider the Heavenly Equal Great Life Benevolent and Holy Emperor of the Eastern Peak.
Responding to creation, He arose at the dawn of chaos;
Established by yin and yang, He governs the vast expanse.
His years equal Heaven’s, His great virtue ever-growing.
Benevolence begets benevolence, embodying the generative power of Qian;
Holiness surpasses holiness, dwelling in the towering majesty of Mount Tai.
He presides over the East among the Five Directions, supreme in the Middle Realm among the Three Realms.
Enacting Heaven’s decrees, He governs the netherworld.
In the Alabaster Pavilion and Stone Gate, His spirit abides in profound silence;
With golden tablets and jade registers, He knows the span of human lives.
He established seventy-five bureaus to wield authority;
He maintains thirty-six prisons to punish the wicked.
Ever securing the nation and sheltering the people,
the state offers sacrifices in due seasons, and all under Heaven come to pay homage in spring.
Perceptive and upright, He grants every request;
His majestic *qi* and numinous power reach even the farthest realms.
All who pray are surely bathed in His compassion.

Thus, we purify our humble abode and establish this ritual of incense and flowers.
With bowed hands and reverent prostration, we gaze upon His august presence;
With devotion and sincerity, we seek to cleanse the sins of all beings.
As if He were present, we are moved and our prayers reach Him.

The assembly, with utmost devotion, chants praises in unison.

**Chant**
We look up to the Heavenly Equal Benevolent and Holy Emperor,
Greatest of the Five Peaks, Mount Tai as its foundation.
He governs the affairs of the world and humanity,
His *qi* concentrated in divine splendor, majestically dwelling in the East.
Lofty and vast is Mount Tai,
its height of four thousand nine hundred *zhang* unmatched.
Its summit is called the Peaceful Peak,
with the Self-Sacrifice Terrace and Jieqiu Peak.
The Hall of Benevolent Peace gleams with lapis lazuli,
its crown and regalia resplendent at its heart.
Ancient emperors performed the feng and shan sacrifices,
ascending to report their achievements and inscribe their success.
Seventy-two rulers are recorded,
beginning with the Yellow Emperor, who first received the honor.
Steles remain, inscribed in Qin script;
to the east lies the Pool of the Senior Officials and the Pine of the Great Master.
The Tang emperor carved an image of aloeswood;
the Song dynasty established the Hall of Meeting the True.
In our dynasty, unity brought heightened reverence,
and the title "Great Life" was lavishly bestowed.
Utmost benevolence and holiness, the people’s ultimate hope,
timely rain and sunshine ensure bountiful years.
With profound reverence, we bow and take refuge,
gazing afar at the cloud-girded palace to honor His compassionate countenance.

The inconceivable merit of harmony is beyond thought.
We raise the Threefold Vows in reverence:
Vow and bow to the Highest Ninefold Qi, the Heavenly Worthy of Numinous Treasure in the East of the Central Heaven.
Vow and bow to the Highest Ninefold Qi, the Heavenly Worthy of the Azure Spirit, the Primordial Elder.
Vow and bow to the Highest Ninefold Qi, the Heavenly Worthy of the Eastern Florescence, the Supreme Minister.

I have heard: the sacred peaks reside between *xun* and *gen*, presiding over judgment and examination; humanity dwells within *qian* and *kun*, and every action accumulates transgressions. The solemn records never fail to inscribe even the slightest detail. Prostrate in reflection, we repentant disciples, transient in this borrowed life, sheltered as human beings—our bodies and hair, skin and limbs, received from our parents; our ears and eyes, nose and mouth, completing our form and spirit—are the most numinous of all creatures, equally endowed with the essence of the Five Phases. Through years and months, days and hours, our faults and offenses pile high as mountains, while our virtuous thoughts fade like dew. The roots of sin are hard to extinguish; evil fills its measure with ease. Unaware of the path of expiation, ignorant of the way to confess, we ponder in silence: how can we justify ourselves? Now, in repentance, we examine our faults, humbly bowing to seek absolution.

On this auspicious day, we pour forth our sunflower sincerity. The censer burns with fragrant incense, the candles blaze with crimson flame. We strike the bell and chime the stone, their sounds harmonizing with the *Step-in-Emptiness* chant; we pour water and offer flowers, our rites never straying from sincerity. Our sacrifice emulates the simplicity of the Western neighbor; our prostrations are offered to the august presence of the Eastern Peak. May our past wrongs be redeemed, our karmic burdens dissolved. With reverence, we rely on repentance, beseeching forgiveness.

The assembly, devout in faith, takes refuge and offers praise.
Each person reverently joins in unison, bowing once.

With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the sovereign of the Eastern Direction, who presides over the Azure Spirit’s treasury of purity on Mount Tai. His stone image stands in majestic dignity; jade tablets record his enfeoffment. His imperial title is bestowed with lavish praise: *Guangsheng*—"Vast Life." From antiquity, his glory endures. Great Compassion, Great Vow, Great Sage, Great Mercy—**Guangsheng Emperor of Mount Tai, Azure Emperor of the Eastern Peak.**

With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the One who embodies virtue and manifests benevolence, guardian of the Eastern Lands. Mount Tai is hailed as the foremost of peaks, ruling the Three Palaces of the Hollow Void; its sacred precinct is supreme, governing the court where gods and spirits are judged. Worship is exalted by imperial decree; his position presides over *Xuanxiao*. Great Compassion, Great Vow, Great Sage, Great Mercy—**Heavenly Equal, Great Life, Benevolent and Sage Emperor of Mount Tai.**

With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the One who, from youth, left home to wander and seek instruction. He received the prophecy of the Supreme Heavenly Worthy and attained transcendence through Dao; he was granted the title of Controller of Destiny and joined the assembly of inspectors. Dwelling in the Office of Destiny on Mount Huo, he was enfeoffed as the Supreme Minister of Mount Tai. Great Compassion, Great Vow, Great Sage, Great Mercy—**Supreme Minister of the Nine Heavens, Controller of Destiny, Bestower of Blessings, Protector and Sage Perfected.**

With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the One whose qi was nurtured by the mountain’s spirit, whose lineage flows from the celestial clan. Earth’s primal power merged with his virtue; he embodied filial piety and benevolence in full. The imperial dream foretold his noble birth, declaring his majesty and valor. As heir to the palace, he received the royal enfeoffment. Great Compassion, Great Vow, Great Sage, Great Mercy—**Supreme Hall, Most Sage, Majestic and Illustrious, Benevolent and Kind King.**

**Incantation:**
The Azure Mystery spreads its true array,
the primordial rank pervades the numinous.
The Fusang guards its entirety,
the firstborn engenders primordial flourishing.
The cinnabar grove scatters its radiance,
nurturing essence and engendering flourishing.
Merging with the mystic splendor,
it subdues and restrains demonic hordes.

With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the **One who encompasses the Great East, Heavenly Equal, Great Life, Benevolent and Sage Emperor of Mount Tai.**
With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the **Foremost of the Sacred Peaks, Heavenly Equal, Great Life, Benevolent and Sage Emperor of Mount Tai.**

With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the **One whose august title is Emperor, Heavenly Equal, Great Life, Benevolent and Sage Emperor of Mount Tai.**

The rites completed, each kneels in reverence, taking refuge in repentance.

We, the assembly of devotees, with single-minded devotion take refuge in the divine, surrendering body and life to the **Guangsheng Emperor of Mount Tai, Heavenly Equal, Great Life, Benevolent and Sage Emperor; the Perfected Lord Controller of Destiny of the Nine Heavens; the Most Sage Illustrious King; the divine lords of the court of Mount Tai, and all majestic numina.**

I have heard: though the mountain’s true form stands immutable in its majestic stability, our bodies are but grand illusions—how could we avoid missteps in our conduct? We humbly beseech the sagely compassion to bestow its vast grace, showering boundless mercy.

In repentance this day, we, the faithful, since time immemorial, since our birth, have borne the heavens and trodden the earth, embraced yin and carried yang, dwelling like ants in clusters, busying ourselves like flies. In our comings and goings, not a single good deed is recorded; in our rising and resting, a hundred transgressions accumulate unnoticed.

At times, we have offended the multitude of sages; at others, exposed ourselves shamelessly beneath the Three Luminaries. We have acted contrary to ritual and moved against righteousness. Racing grand carriages and fine steeds along the paths of fame and profit; donning fine linen and light furs, indulging in excess beyond all measure of splendor. Our conduct has been full of secrecy and perversity, our pursuits beyond what is proper. We have received this single form yet remain ignorant of the Three Reflections. Thus, transgressions accumulate, boundless and immeasurable.

We humbly beseech the multitude of sages to bestow their grace, the host of Perfected to confer their blessings. Extending benevolence to all things, may they untangle the entanglements of bodily karma; preserving life and prolonging years, may they shatter the mountain of our sins. We further pray that this vast response may extend equally to all living beings.

With devoted hearts, we bow our heads in reverence, offering thanks to the Most Supreme Treasure of the Perfect Dao.

**The Most Sagely Treasure of the Dao, Heavenly Worthy**
We take refuge in the Supreme Dao, honored in the Three Realms of Great Purity.
In repentance, all faithful,
May the transgressions of bodily karma be dissolved.
The four wrongs all eradicated,
Seeing goodness, we daily transform.
If we examine ourselves without cease,
Fortune and blessings will naturally extend our years.

**Heavenly Worthy Who Dissolves Bodily Karma**
*Incantation*
Virtue flourishes in wood,
Corresponding above to the Year Star.
Ancestor of the Five Peaks,
Grandchild of the Heavenly Emperor.
The sun resides in the East,
Gateway of Heaven.
Mists swirl in abundance,
Joyful qi intermingles in harmony.
With devoted hearts, we bow and worship:
In the eastern image of the sun—
The Heavenly Equal, Great Life, Benevolent and Sagely Emperor of Mount Tai.
With devoted hearts, we bow and worship:
Revered by the Four Peaks—
The Heavenly Equal, Great Life, Benevolent and Sagely Emperor of Mount Tai.
With devoted hearts, we bow and worship:
Vast and boundless as Heaven—
The Heavenly Equal, Great Life, Benevolent and Sagely Emperor of Mount Tai.
With devoted hearts, we bow and worship:
The Nine Qi conjoined as one—
The Heavenly Equal, Great Life, Benevolent and Sagely Emperor of Mount Tai.

Great and transformative—

Having completed the rites, we each kneel in reverence, taking refuge and repenting.

We, the assembled faithful, with devoted hearts take refuge in body, take refuge in spirit, take refuge in life:
The Lord Controller of Vast Life of Mount Tai, the Heavenly Equal, Great Life, Benevolent and Sagely Emperor;
The Perfected Lord Controller of Destiny of the Nine Heavens;
The Most Sage Illustrious King;
The divine lords of the court of Mount Tai, and all majestic numina.

We have heard: as the mountain anchors the rivers and peaks, wondrously silent and scentless; yet when the mouth speaks, often what is right becomes wrong. We humbly beseech the sagely compassion to bestow its vast grace, showering boundless mercy.

In repentance this day, we, since former lives until now, have indulged in ornate speech and clever words, sharp tongues and harsh voices, boastful discourse and lofty talk, wild singing and reckless laughter. Immersed in wine and intoxication, we have pursued pleasure without restraint; consuming meat and fish, we have deemed delicacies insufficient. At times, we have berated the wind and scolded the rain; at others, resented the heat and lamented the cold.

In repentance, we recall that since our birth until today, the six senses have clashed, the seven emotions have gone unchecked. Cunning calculations arise, and greed runs rampant. Desires have roamed unbridled, indulging in excess without measure; virtue has been forgotten in favor of wealth and rank. We have committed every manner of depravity, perversity, and extravagance; anger, fear, and dread have led us astray. We have concealed our own faults while undermining others’ strengths. Envious of the worthy and resentful of the capable, we have obscured our spiritual terrace, remaining unaware. We have bullied the lonely and weak, believing the darkness of our chambers could conceal our deeds. Mixing falsehood with truth, we have embraced the new while forgetting the old. Our hearts, benighted, have failed to awaken to the Nine Contemplations. Thus, grievances have multiplied, beyond naming or recounting.

We humbly beseech the Sagely Emperor to bestow compassion, the Perfected Spirits to perceive with clarity. Above, may they fulfill the intent of benevolence, pardoning the transgressions of our mental karma; below, may they satisfy human desires, bringing joy as radiant as the spring terrace. We further pray that this vast blessing may extend equally to all living beings.

With devoted hearts, we bow our heads in reverence, offering thanks to the Most Supreme Treasure of the Perfect Scriptures.

**The Most Sagely Treasure of the Scriptures, Heavenly Worthy**
We take refuge in the Supreme Scriptures, honored in the Thirty-Six Sections.
In repentance, all faithful,
May the transgressions of mental karma be dissolved.
Ever pure and ever still,
Desires naturally do not arise.
Within and without, both chaste and bright,
May we forever preserve the tranquility of the Dao-mind.

We, the assembled faithful, with utmost devotion take refuge in body, take refuge in spirit, take refuge in life:
The Lord Controller of Vast Life of Mount Tai, the Heavenly Equal, Great Life, Benevolent and Sagely Emperor;
The Perfected Lord Controller of Destiny of the Nine Heavens;

We have heard: the mountain stabilizes the rivers and peaks, wondrously silent and scentless; yet when the mouth speaks, often what is right becomes wrong. We humbly beseech the sagely compassion to bestow its vast grace, showering boundless mercy.

In repentance, we recall that since former lives until now, we have indulged in ornate speech and clever words, sharp tongues and harsh voices, boastful discourse and lofty talk, wild singing and reckless laughter. Immersed in wine and intoxication, we have pursued pleasure without restraint; consuming meat and fish, we have deemed delicacies insufficient. At times, we have berated the wind and scolded the rain; at others, resented the heat and lamented the cold.

We have scorned the Dao, flattered the gods, belittled the Confucians, and slandered the Buddhist teachings. With a three-inch tongue, we have sowed discord among the six relations; with a single deceitful heart, we have stirred strife between two parties. Our ornate words have deluded the masses; our boasts of wealth have humiliated the poor. Ever relying on glib tongues, we have seldom heeded the caution of sealing our lips. Our accumulated transgressions run deep, and even washing our hair would fail to count them all.

We humbly beseech the sagely Emperor to show compassion, the true numina to take pity. May your virtuous decrees be proclaimed, that our oral karmic offenses may be cleansed; may the realm attain purity and peace, and the sound of teachings gradually spread. We further pray for your vast blessings to extend equally to all sentient beings.

With devoted hearts, we bow our heads in reverence, offering homage to the Supreme and Rightly Enlightened Master Treasure.

Great Sage Master Treasure, Heavenly Worthy,
We take refuge in the Supreme Master, revered by humans and gods alike.
In repentance, all faithful,
Pray to dissolve the transgressions of speech.
Like a sealed jar, guard well,
A single word worth a thousand gold.
When words are full yet faults are none,
All becomes pure and tranquil sound.

Merciful Heavenly Worthy Who Dissolves Oral Karma,
We circumambulate in the void, treading the cloud-net,
Scattering flowers.

We have heard: whether one does good or evil, it is surely not concealed from the divine; whether fortune or misfortune descends, each is governed by its respective office. Within the six directions, all things great and small, every being with form and qi, are all under their jurisdiction. There are officials to record merits and transgressions, to oversee life, death, and registration. They govern both the unseen and the manifest, administering the affairs of people and all creatures.

Now, we repentant faithful, dwelling in the dusty world with mortal roots, have in times past seen what is right yet failed to act; deemed small evils harmless and thus not abandoned them. These have brewed into manifold sins, and we fear a hundred calamities. Relying on utmost sincerity, we look up and pray for your great response, to guide us toward future blessings and atone for past transgressions.

With bowed heads, we take refuge and reverently pay homage.

Proceeding with the *Eliminating Karmic Obstructions* Heavenly Worthy,
chanting the *Pacing the Void*:

We have heard: all human transgressions arise from a single misguided thought;
making goodness one’s teacher may bring the descent of a hundred blessings.
If one does not forestall calamity in advance,
surely swift retribution will befall the self.
Awakening to self-renewal,
one turns back in reflection.
Taking refuge in the Three Treasures,
we hope the three karmic actions will melt like ice;
paying homage to the host of Perfected Ones,
we pray all transgressions will be swept away like lightning.
With the six senses purified,
ten thousand sins are absolved.
Thus, for errors unwittingly committed,
and for transgressions taught to others,
we repent past deeds and seek release,
prostrating to trace the source of all faults.

Once more, we reflect with reverence upon the numinous radiance,
bowing in earnest supplication.
Day by day, we uphold solemn devotion,
undaunted by repetition;
Heaven’s mandate is not constant,
yet blessings flow abundantly from the Nine-Five.
Grant us further the gift of trustworthy grace,
that we may become people without fault.
We humbly pray that the great winds of benevolence may spread,
fanning the withering of karmic blossoms;
that the sagely grace may universally moisten,
nurturing the growth of good fruits.

We, your servants, overwhelmed with gratitude,
prostrate ourselves in deepest reverence, and respectfully submit this petition.

*Three Petitions*
*Three Bows*

We, your servants Fa and Zhong, with devoted hearts and bowed heads, take refuge in the Most High Three Honored Ones and the sacred assemblies of the ten directions, performing the rites of the *Canonical Scriptures* in accordance with the Dharma.

With devoted hearts, we prostrate and bow to the Most High Boundless Great Dao.
With devoted hearts, we prostrate and bow to the Thirty-Six Divisions of the Venerable Scriptures.
With devoted hearts, we prostrate and bow to the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center.

*Twelve Vows*
First, may the blessings of one person extend to all.
Second, may the Two Luminaries of the altar shine brightly.
Third, may the Three Agricultural Seasons bring joy and prosperity.
Fourth, may the Four Seasons be harmonious and peaceful.
Fifth, may the sacrifices of the Two and Five be firm and enduring.
Sixth, may the Six Directions be pure and clear.
Seventh, may the Seven Stars trace their radiant paths.
Eighth, may the Eight Festivals bring peace and prosperity.
Ninth, may the Nine Springs open to great fortune.
Tenth, may the Ten Directions flourish and thrive.
Eleventh, may blessings flow to all good and faithful followers.
Twelfth, may the Great Dao flourish and prevail.

Thus far,
thus far have our morning devotions and rites of repentance been completed in full.

We now turn to offer thanks to the Greatly Compassionate and Sagely Emperor of the Eastern Peak, Heavenly Equal of Creation, and to all the numinous powers of Mount Tai.
Humbly we beseech your sagely grace to bestow your vast protection.

May our supreme wish be that the reigning Emperor,
equal in longevity to Heaven,
enjoy an everlasting and boundless reign,
laying down arms to cultivate culture,
so that the era of warfare may forever cease.
May the myriad people sing in praise of his virtuous rule,
and the four quarters rejoice in the Great Peace.
May yin and yang flow smoothly,
and the seasons bring abundant harvests.

Next, may our wish be that the faithful devotee [Name],
seeking repentance,
have their transgressions erased from the Black Registers for all eternity,
and their name inscribed in the Azure Records for eternal life.
May all places be blessed with primordial fortune,
and all people dwell in peace and harmony.
May the nine generations of ancestors ascend as immortals,
and the ten directions together rejoice.

May all sentient beings of every kind
share in the bounty of fulfillment’s grace;
may the souls lost in the long night’s darkness
all bathe in the transforming light of transcendence.

For this supreme cause,
we invoke the East’s Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy,
the Azure Spirit Primal Elder Heavenly Worthy,
the Eastern Flower Upper Minister Heavenly Worthy,
and the Boundless Life-Bestowing Heavenly Worthy—
their merits unfathomable, their virtues beyond thought.

Here ends the *Great Life-Repentance Sutra of the Eastern Peak*.

chunks.original_text: 东岳大生宝忏 经名：东岳大生宝忏。 一卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》洞玄部威仪类。 东岳大生宝忏 净天地咒　净坛 启白 香腾端霭，溶溶徧满於太虚； 人秉精诚，翼翼敢违於咫尺。 恭焚宝香，上启供养，东岳泰山青帝广生帝君，东岳天齐大生仁圣帝，九天司命上卿真君，上殿至圣威雄炳灵仁惠王，东岳淑明皇后，护国西齐大王，蓬玄空洞洞天仙官，长白山储副仙官，梁父山储副仙官，圣嗣佑灵侯惠灵侯静鉴大师宣灵侯，四岳四天圣帝，左右上相张康二大圣，显应千圣小王地府崔府君，蒿里丈人增福相公，昭惠灵显王，护国显应王，清源妙道真君，义勇武安王崇宁真君，护国嘉应公( )河灵派侯，六部尚书、善部尚书、恶部尚书，六曹卿监镇殿二将军，左右金吾卫将军，三元吴客三侯真君，左右二阙神白骡大王，地祇主令温元帅，地祇院九大元帅，追魂朱太尉，协真侯刘元帅，七十五司判官、二十四案主者，三十六洞天仙官、七十二福地仙官、靖庐福地治化仙官，岱岳朝班圣众，今年太岁一神君灵济侯高都督，天下都大城隍主者，九州社令神祇，年月日时四直功曹，属府州县祀典庙貌神祇。 悉仗真香，普同供养。 香乃紫虚郁秀，灵风聚烟，香云密罗，径御洞天。 当愿香官使者，为臣通奏，上闻帝前。 令臣所启，咸赐如言入意，具诸情悃，已露敷宣。 伏望云拥旌旗，离虎关而下迈； 风清警跸，听鸾辂之和鸣。 森罗百辟以骖随，环列千官而扈从。 齐临尘陋，俯察精纯。 今则兰场洁备，宝炷浓熏，对越圣真，宣扬忏法。 稽首皈依，无极大道。 举三皈依 志心皈依，十方道宝。 当愿众生起心回向，一切信礼。 志心皈依，十方经宝。 当愿众生心开悟解，受持转诵。 志心皈依，十方师宝。 当愿众生普上法桥，无有障碍。 启白 臣闻：浑沦未判，渺一炁以无垠； 高下既陈，奠三才而有象。 地爰分於五岳，权莫重於泰山。 标雄齐鲁之邦，作镇角亢之分。 虞朝岁狩，礼重燔柴。 周世时巡，礼严用币。 是宗是仰，无比无伦。 恭惟东岳天齐大生仁圣帝。 应乎造化，生於混沌之初； 立自阴阳，镇彼幅员之域。 与天齐久，大德日生。 仁以得仁，体乾元之发育； 圣而益圣，居泰岱之喜峣。 五方端处於东方，三界独尊於中界。 奉行天令，宰御阴司。 阿阁石闾，维神居之渊默； 金箧玉策，知人寿之短长。 设七十五司，以掌权衡； 有三十六狱，以惩凶恶。 永绥邦社，大庇民区。 国家致祭於岁时，率土来朝於春月。 聪明正直，有欲必从。 炁焰威灵，无远弗届。 凡伸祈祷，谅沐慈怜。 是以洁蓬荜之尘居，建香花之法会。 拜手稽首，具瞻咫尺之威容； 皈命投诚，期涤万生之罪垢。 洋乎如在，感而遂通。 法众虔诚，称扬赞咏。 众诵 仰启天齐仁圣帝，五岳最巨岱为宗。 分掌世界人间事，炁锺神秀俨居东。 截彼泰山高且大，四千九百丈汝空。 山顶名为太平顶，舍身台与介丘峰。 仁安殿宇琉璃莹，冠冕巍然御正中。 上古帝王修封禅，升中告代勒成功。 七十二君名具列，始自轩辕得上封。 碑碣犹存秦篆刻，水池东列大夫松。 唐皇镂刻沉香像，宋室建置会真宫。 国朝混一加尊礼，大生二字侈褒崇。 至仁至圣为民极，时雨时旸相岁丰。 倾倒虔恭皈命请，遥瞻云阙礼慈容。

The inconceivable merit of harmony is beyond thought.
We raise the Threefold Vows in reverence:
Vow and bow to the Highest Ninefold Qi, the Heavenly Worthy of Numinous Treasure in the East of the Central Heaven.
Vow and bow to the Highest Ninefold Qi, the Heavenly Worthy of the Azure Spirit, the Primordial Elder.
Vow and bow to the Highest Ninefold Qi, the Heavenly Worthy of the Eastern Florescence, the Supreme Minister.

I have heard: the sacred peaks reside between *xun* and *gen*, presiding over judgment and examination; humanity dwells within *qian* and *kun*, and every action accumulates transgressions. The solemn records never fail to inscribe even the slightest detail. Prostrate in reflection, we repentant disciples, transient in this borrowed life, sheltered as human beings—our bodies and hair, skin and limbs, received from our parents; our ears and eyes, nose and mouth, completing our form and spirit—are the most numinous of all creatures, equally endowed with the essence of the Five Phases. Through years and months, days and hours, our faults and offenses pile high as mountains, while our virtuous thoughts fade like dew. The roots of sin are hard to extinguish; evil fills its measure with ease. Unaware of the path of expiation, ignorant of the way to confess, we ponder in silence: how can we justify ourselves? Now, in repentance, we examine our faults, humbly bowing to seek absolution.

On this auspicious day, we pour forth our sunflower sincerity. The censer burns with fragrant incense, the candles blaze with crimson flame. We strike the bell and chime the stone, their sounds harmonizing with the *Step-in-Emptiness* chant; we pour water and offer flowers, our rites never straying from sincerity. Our sacrifice emulates the simplicity of the Western neighbor; our prostrations are offered to the august presence of the Eastern Peak. May our past wrongs be redeemed, our karmic burdens dissolved. With reverence, we rely on repentance, beseeching forgiveness.

The assembly, devout in faith, takes refuge and offers praise.
Each person reverently joins in unison, bowing once.

With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the sovereign of the Eastern Direction, who presides over the Azure Spirit’s treasury of purity on Mount Tai. His stone image stands in majestic dignity; jade tablets record his enfeoffment. His imperial title is bestowed with lavish praise: *Guangsheng*—"Vast Life." From antiquity, his glory endures. Great Compassion, Great Vow, Great Sage, Great Mercy—**Guangsheng Emperor of Mount Tai, Azure Emperor of the Eastern Peak.**

With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the One who embodies virtue and manifests benevolence, guardian of the Eastern Lands. Mount Tai is hailed as the foremost of peaks, ruling the Three Palaces of the Hollow Void; its sacred precinct is supreme, governing the court where gods and spirits are judged. Worship is exalted by imperial decree; his position presides over *Xuanxiao*. Great Compassion, Great Vow, Great Sage, Great Mercy—**Heavenly Equal, Great Life, Benevolent and Sage Emperor of Mount Tai.**

With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the One who, from youth, left home to wander and seek instruction. He received the prophecy of the Supreme Heavenly Worthy and attained transcendence through Dao; he was granted the title of Controller of Destiny and joined the assembly of inspectors. Dwelling in the Office of Destiny on Mount Huo, he was enfeoffed as the Supreme Minister of Mount Tai. Great Compassion, Great Vow, Great Sage, Great Mercy—**Supreme Minister of the Nine Heavens, Controller of Destiny, Bestower of Blessings, Protector and Sage Perfected.**

With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the One whose qi was nurtured by the mountain’s spirit, whose lineage flows from the celestial clan. Earth’s primal power merged with his virtue; he embodied filial piety and benevolence in full. The imperial dream foretold his noble birth, declaring his majesty and valor. As heir to the palace, he received the royal enfeoffment. Great Compassion, Great Vow, Great Sage, Great Mercy—**Supreme Hall, Most Sage, Majestic and Illustrious, Benevolent and Kind King.**

With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the **Virtuous and Radiant August Empress of the Eastern Peak.**
With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the **Great King of the Western Qi, Protector of the Realm.**
With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the **Immortal Officials of the Blue-Green Cavern of the Hollow Void.**
With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the **Vice-Regent Immortal Officials of Mount Changbai.**
With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the **Vice-Regent Immortal Officials of Mount Liangfu.**
With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the **Marquis of Blessing and Protection, Divine Heir.**
With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the **Marquis of Kindness and Numinosity, Divine Heir.**
With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the **Great Master of Serene Discernment, Divine Heir.**
With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the **Marquis of Manifest Numinosity, Divine Heir.**
With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the **August Emperor of Great Transformation, Ruler of the Southern Peak.**
With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the **August Emperor of Great Prosperity and Favorable Omens, Ruler of the Western Peak.**
With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the **August Emperor of Great Truth and Mystic Sanctity, Ruler of the Northern Peak.**
With single-minded devotion, we bow in homage to the **August Emperor of Great Tranquility and Exalted Sanctity, Ruler of the Central Peak.**

**Incantation:**
The Azure Mystery spreads its true array,
the primordial rank pervades the numinous.
The Fusang guards its entirety,
the firstborn engenders primordial flourishing.
The cinnabar grove scatters its radiance,
nurturing essence and engendering flourishing.
Merging with the mystic splendor,
it subdues and restrains demonic hordes.

We humbly beseech the sagely Emperor to show compassion, the true numina to take pity. We have heard: all human transgressions arise from a single misguided thought;
making goodness one’s teacher may bring the descent of a hundred blessings.
If one does not forestall calamity in advance,
surely swift retribution will befall the self.
Awakening to self-renewal,
one turns back in reflection.
Taking refuge in the Three Treasures,
we hope the three karmic actions will melt like ice;
paying homage to the host of Perfected Ones,
we pray all transgressions will be swept away like lightning.
With the six senses purified,
ten thousand sins are absolved.
Thus, for errors unwittingly committed,
and for transgressions taught to others,
we repent past deeds and seek release,
prostrating to trace the source of all faults.

Once more, we reflect with reverence upon the numinous radiance,
bowing in earnest supplication.
Day by day, we uphold solemn devotion,
undaunted by repetition;
Heaven’s mandate is not constant,
yet blessings flow abundantly from the Nine-Five.

that we may become people without fault.
We humbly pray that the great winds of benevolence may spread,
fanning the withering of karmic blossoms;
that the sagely grace may universally moisten,
nurturing the growth of good fruits.

prostrate ourselves in deepest reverence, and respectfully submit this petition.

*Twelve Vows*
First, may the blessings of one person extend to all.
Second, may the Two Luminaries of the altar shine brightly.
Third, may the Three Agricultural Seasons bring joy and prosperity.
Fourth, may the Four Seasons be harmonious and peaceful.
Fifth, may the sacrifices of the Two and Five be firm and enduring.
Sixth, may the Six Directions be pure and clear.
Seventh, may the Seven Stars trace their radiant paths.
Eighth, may the Eight Festivals bring peace and prosperity.
Ninth, may the Nine Springs open to great fortune.
Tenth, may the Ten Directions flourish and thrive.
Eleventh, may blessings flow to all good and faithful followers.
Twelfth, may the Great Dao flourish and prevail.

Thus far,
thus far have our morning devotions and rites of repentance been completed in full.

We now turn to offer thanks to the Greatly Compassionate and Sagely Emperor of the Eastern Peak, Heavenly Equal of Creation, and to all the numinous powers of Mount Tai.
Humbly we beseech your sagely grace to bestow your vast protection.

May our supreme wish be that the reigning Emperor,
equal in longevity to Heaven,
enjoy an everlasting and boundless reign,
laying down arms to cultivate culture,
so that the era of warfare may forever cease.
May the myriad people sing in praise of his virtuous rule,
and the four quarters rejoice in the Great Peace.
May yin and yang flow smoothly,
and the seasons bring abundant harvests.

Next, may our wish be that the faithful devotee [Name],
seeking repentance,
have their transgressions erased from the Black Registers for all eternity,
and their name inscribed in the Azure Records for eternal life.
May all places be blessed with primordial fortune,
and all people dwell in peace and harmony.
May the nine generations of ancestors ascend as immortals,
and the ten directions together rejoice.
